content: People of my generation (born 1955) are at the point in our lives when we would feel better if we got credit for our accomplishments, good intentions, the ways we made the world better, but itâ€™s dawning on us that we didnâ€™t make as much of a difference as we hoped to, and what little we did accomplish will largely go unrecognized.
